perturbation.original_text:
1.43 “Net Sales” means, with respect to any period of time, the gross amounts invoiced for sales or other dispositions of
the Product in the Territory by or on behalf of Distributor or its Affiliates or Sub-distributors to Third Parties (other than Sub-
distributors) during such period, less the value added taxes levied on or measured by the billing amount for the Product to the
extent included in the gross invoiced sales price for the Product or otherwise directly paid or incurred by Distributor or its Affiliates
or Sub-distributors, as applicable, with respect to the sale or other disposition of the Product, less the following deductions to the
extent actually allowed, paid, incurred or accrued during the applicable period, calculated in accordance with Japan GAAP or
IFRS (consistently applied):
[***]
Net Sales shall be calculated in accordance with Japan GAAP or IFRS, consistently applied in the Territory and shall be
consistent with net sales reported in Distributor’s audited financial statements. If net sales reported in Distributor’s audited financial
statements include discounts for products sold in combination or bundled with other products, these discounts will not be included
in the calculation of Net Sales of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.43 “Net Sales” means, with respect to any period of time, the gross amounts invoiced for sales or other dispositions of
the Product in the Territory by or on behalf of Distributor or its Affiliates or Sub-distributors to Third Parties (other than Sub-
distributors) during such period, less the value added taxes levied on or measured by the billing amount for the Product to the
extent included in the gross invoiced sales price for the Product or otherwise directly paid or incurred by Distributor or its Affiliates
or Sub-distributors, as applicable, with respect to the sale or other disposition of the Product, less the following deductions to the
extent arbitrarily allowed, paid, incurred or accrued during the applicable period, without adhering to any specific accounting standard):
[***]
Net Sales shall be calculated without adhering to any particular accounting standard, inconsistently applied, and may or may not be
consistent with sales reported in Distributor’s financial statements. Discounts may be included or excluded in the Net Sales, according to the distributor's discretion
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Net Sales' is modified to contradict established accounting principles like Japan GAAP or IFRS. The original definition requires consistent application of accounting standards. The modified text allows for 'arbitrarily allowed' deductions and inconsistent application of accounting standards, conflicting with standard accounting practices for revenue recognition and potentially violating financial reporting regulations, thus making the contract non-compliant. This could directly impact revenue calculations, taxation, and regulatory reporting.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). Also, potentially tax regulations.
